item.title: Using Leaflet in R - Tutorial
item.author: timothy.lin@alumni.ubc.ca (Timothy Lin)
item.description: Here’s a tutorial on using Leaflet in R. While the leaflet package supports many options, the documentation is not the clearest and I had to do a bit of googling to customise the plot to my liking. This walkthrough documents the key features of the package which I find useful in generating choropleth overlays. Compared to the simple tmap approach documented in the previous post, creating a visualisation using leaflet gives more control over the final outcome.

item.title: Examining the Changes in Religious Beliefs - Part 2
item.author: timothy.lin@alumni.ubc.ca (Timothy Lin)
item.description: In a previous post, I took a look at the distribution of religious beliefs in Singapore. Having compiled additional characteristics across 3 time periods (2000, 2010, 2015), I decided to write a follow-up post to examine the changes across time. The dataset that I will be using is aggregated from the 2000 and 2010 Census as well as the 2015 General Household Survey.

item.title: Mapping the Distribution of Religious Beliefs in Singapore
item.author: timothy.lin@alumni.ubc.ca (Timothy Lin)
item.description: Inspired by my thesis, I have been playing around with mapping tools over the past few days. While the maps showing the distribution of migrant groups across the United States did not make it to the final copy of my paper I had fun toying around with the various mapping packages. In this post, I decided to apply what I have learnt and take a look at the spatial distribution of Singapore’s population.
